theory.introduction: Dictionaries store data in key-value pairs, allowing you to quickly look up a value using its key.
theory.explanation: Dictionaries use `{}` with pairs like `'name': 'Shridhar'`. You can access values using their keys, add new pairs, and modify existing ones. Keys must be unique and immutable.
keyPoints: Create with `{}` and colon `:` between keys and values
importantNotes: ‚ö†Ô∏è Accessing missing keys directly causes an error ‚Äî use `.get()` instead

task.description: Make a dictionary with your name and age. Then add a new key `language` with the value `Python`. Print the whole dictionary.
